intro: Thunbergia proximoides, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or forest understory environments.
